intro: Plagiogyria lanuginosa, commonly known as the silky plagiogyria, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy, or lanuginose, stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of Europe and Asia, often found in moist, calcareous soils. Due to its delicate appearance and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
